should be linked.--> | replacement = <!--If there is an appropriate article, this should be linked.--> | type = | manufacturer = <!--Must not be linked, will auto-categorize the ride.--> | designer = Jeff Henry & John Schooley | model = [[Water slide#Water coaster|Water coaster]] | course = | lift = | height_ft = 168 | height_m = <!--Must be expressed in metres and may contain only numeric characters.--> | drop_ft = <!--Must be expressed in feet and may contain only numeric characters.--> | drop_m = <!--Must be expressed in metres and may contain only numeric characters.--> | length_ft = <!--Must be expressed in feet and may contain only numeric characters.--> | length_m = <!--Must be expressed in metres and may contain only numeric characters.--> | speed_mph = 70 | speed_km/h = <!--Must be expressed in kilometres per hour and may contain only numeric characters.--> | duration = | angle = 60 | capacity = | gforce = | restriction_ft = <!--Must be expressed in feet and may contain only numeric characters.--> | restriction_in = 54 | restriction_cm = <!--Must be expressed in centimetres and may contain only numeric characters.--> | boats =10<ref name="Indictment-Henry/Schooley" /> | riders_per_row = 1 | rows_per_boat = 3 | custom_label_1 = | custom_value_1 = | custom_label_2 = | custom_value_2 = | custom_label_3 = | custom_value_3 = | custom_label_4 = | custom_value_4 = | virtual_queue_name = | virtual_queue_image = <!--Use ONLY the filename, not a full [[Image:]] link--> | virtual_queue_status = <!--should be available if above fields are used--> | virtual_queue_name2 = | virtual_queue_image2= <!--Use ONLY the filename, not a full [[Image:]] link--> | virtual_queue_status2=<!--should be available if above fields are used--> | single_rider = <!--Should be "available" if available--> | accessible = <!--Should be "available" if available--> | transfer_accessible = <!--Should be "available" if available--> }} '''Verrückt''' ([[German language|German]] for ''crazy'' or ''insane'') was a water slide at the [[Schlitterbahn Kansas City]] water park. At {{convert|168|ft|7|in}}, the slide became the world's tallest water slide when it opened in 2014, surpassing the Kilimanjaro at Aldeia das Águas Park Resort.<ref name="Guinness World Records Entry">{{cite web|title=Tallest water slide|url=http://www.guinnessworldrecords.com/world-records/tallest-water-slide|publisher=Guinness World Records|accessdate=August 10, 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160805020820/http://www.guinnessworldrecords.com/world-records/tallest-water-slide|archivedate=August 5, 2016}}</ref><ref name="Guinness World Records Story">{{cite web|last1=Janela|first1=Mike|title=Meet Verrückt: the world's new tallest water slide|url=http://www.guinnessworldrecords.com/news/2014/5/meet-verrueckt-the-worlds-new-tallest-water-slide-57097|publisher=Guinness World Records|accessdate=August 10, 2016|date=May 5, 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140510231544/http://www.guinnessworldrecords.com/news/2014/5/meet-verrueckt-the-worlds-new-tallest-water-slide-57097|archive-date=May 10, 2014|dead-url=no|df=mdy-all}}</ref><ref name="Official Site"/> Following a fatal incident involving a 10-year-old boy in 2016, the ride was closed permanently. Criminal charges led to the arrests of several individuals, including the park's owner and a co-designer of the ride.
==History== In November 2012, owners of Schlitterbahn Kansas City announced plans for the creation of the world's tallest and fastest [[water slide]], with it opening during their Summer season in 2013.<ref name="Amusement Today">{{cite web |url=http://www.amusementtoday.com/2012/11/20/worlds-tallest-water-coaster-coming-to-schlitterbahn-kansas-city/ |title=World’s tallest water coaster coming to Schlitterbahn Kansas City |date=November 20, 2012 |publisher=Amusement Today |accessdate=July 21, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140727104648/http://www.amusementtoday.com/2012/11/20/worlds-tallest-water-coaster-coming-to-schlitterbahn-kansas-city/ |archivedate=July 27, 2014 }}</ref> No name was given during the announcement, while specifications on the height of the ride were kept secret in order to ensure that the completed ride would set a world record for its creation.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Stagemeyer|first1=Suzanna|title=Schlitterbahn announces cryptic plans for record-breaking waterslide in Kansas City, Kan. – Kansas City Business Journal|url=http://www.bizjournals.com/kansascity/news/2012/11/14/schlitterbahn-announces-cryptic-plans.html|accessdate=August 10, 2016|work=Kansas City Business Journal|date=November 14, 2012|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160818100326/http://www.bizjournals.com/kansascity/news/2012/11/14/schlitterbahn-announces-cryptic-plans.html|archivedate=August 18, 2016}}</ref> The plans for the water slide were conceived as a spur of the moment idea by Schlitterbahn co-owner Jeff Henry, after he was asked by a team working on [[Travel Channel|Travel Channel's]] ''[[List of programs broadcast by Travel Channel|Xtreme Waterparks]]'' what he was working on while attending a trade show.<ref name="Grantland">{{cite news|last1=Curtis|first1=Bryan|title=The Wet Stuff|url=http://grantland.com/features/the-wet-stuff-verruckt-waterslide-schlitterbahn/|work=Grantland|date=September 10, 2014|access-date=April 11, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180411171218/http://grantland.com/features/the-wet-stuff-verruckt-waterslide-schlitterbahn/#|archive-date=April 11, 2018|dead-url=no|df=mdy-all}}</ref> After initial attempts to pitch the idea to vendors at the show failed,<ref name="Indictment-Henry/Schooley" /> Henry decided to build the slide himself,<ref>{{cite news|last1=Herndon|first1=Astead|title=World's tallest water slide finally open {{!}} CNN Travel|url=https://www.cnn.com/travel/article/worlds-tallest-water-slide/index.html|work=CNN Travel|date=June 26, 2014|language=en|access-date=April 11, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180411171211/https://www.cnn.com/travel/article/worlds-tallest-water-slide/index.html#|archive-date=April 11, 2018|dead-url=no|df=mdy-all}}</ref> with assistance on the design provided by ride designer John Schooley.<ref name="kcstarindictment" />
In November 2013, the ride was officially named [[wiktionary:verrückt|Verrückt]], the German word for crazy or insane, with the opening date pushed back until the start of the park's 2014 season.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Zimmerman |first1=Neetzan |title=The World's Tallest Waterslide Looks as Terrifying As It Sounds |url=http://gawker.com/the-worlds-tallest-waterslide-looks-as-terrifying-as-i-1467661327 |website=Gawker |accessdate=August 10, 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160819024611/http://gawker.com/the-worlds-tallest-waterslide-looks-as-terrifying-as-i-1467661327 |archivedate=August 19, 2016 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Rizzo|first1=Tom|last2=Darby|first2=Adam|title=Verruckt, the world’s tallest and fastest water slide, is taking shape in KCK|url=http://www.kansas.com/news/article1127973.html|accessdate=August 10, 2016|work=The Wichita Eagle|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160810161334/http://www.kansas.com/news/article1127973.html|archivedate=August 10, 2016}}</ref> When the park opened, delays in construction and testing of the ride led to its opening date being pushed back to June 5,<ref>{{cite news|last1=McCallister|first1=Laura|title=Schlitterbahn's Verruckt 'not behaving properly'|url=http://www.kctv5.com/story/25590567/worlds-of-fun-new-ride-wont-open-on-saturday|accessdate=August 10, 2016|work=KCTV|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160812064030/http://www.kctv5.com/story/25590567/worlds-of-fun-new-ride-wont-open-on-saturday|archivedate=August 12, 2016}}</ref> and then June 29, after the lower portion of the ride was rebuilt, to coincide with a television special about the ride;<ref>{{cite news|last1=Foster|first1=Brian|title=World's tallest water slide to open in late June|url=http://www.kmbc.com/news/worlds-tallest-water-slide-to-open-in-late-june/26254026|accessdate=August 10, 2016|work=KMBC|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160825233556/http://www.kmbc.com/news/worlds-tallest-water-slide-to-open-in-late-june/26254026|archivedate=August 25, 2016}}</ref> the park later cancelled this opening date and two days of media previews following further delays with the ride.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Arnett|first1=Dugan|title=After third delay, no new opening date for Schlitterbahn’s Verrückt (with new POV video)|url=http://www.kansascity.com/entertainment/article634033.html|accessdate=August 10, 2016|work=The Kansas City Star|date=June 27, 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160811113013/http://www.kansascity.com/entertainment/article634033.html|archivedate=August 11, 2016}}</ref> The ride was eventually completed and officially opened on July 10, 2014.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.kansascity.com/entertainment/article697346.html|title=Schlitterbahn:First riders on Verrückt at Schlitterbahn love the ‘rush’ (with video)|newspaper=[[The Kansas City Star]]|publisher=[[The McClatchy Company]]|first=Edward|last=Eveld|date=July 9, 2014|accessdate=July 10, 2014|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140712023925/http://www.kansascity.com/entertainment/article697346.html|archivedate=July 12, 2014}}</ref>
Following its opening, Verrückt was voted the world's "[[Golden Ticket Award for Best New Ride|Best New Waterpark Ride]]" at the 2014 [[Golden Ticket Awards]].<ref name="2k14">{{cite journal|title=Park and ride winners|journal=[[Amusement Today]]|date=September 2014|url=http://www.goldenticketawards.com/2014-park-ride-winners/|accessdate=September 7, 2014|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140909194347/http://www.goldenticketawards.com/2014-park-ride-winners|archivedate=September 9, 2014}}</ref>
==Design== Verrückt was designed to consist of two drops, the initial being a 17-story plunge, with a five-story uphill mid-section.<ref name="Indictment-Henry/Schooley" /> The ride was designed to accommodate the use of three-person rafts, each weighing {{convert|100|lb}} and carried up by conveyor to the top of the slide, while riders were required to climb 264 steps to reach the top.<ref>{{cite news|title=Schlitterbahn cancels media preview of world's tallest water slide|url=http://www.kmbc.com/news/schlitterbahn-cancels-media-preview-of-worlds-tallest-water-slide/26662130|accessdate=August 10, 2016|work=KMBC|date=June 26, 2014|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160812154818/http://www.kmbc.com/news/schlitterbahn-cancels-media-preview-of-worlds-tallest-water-slide/26662130|archivedate=August 12, 2016}}</ref> To avoid issues with rafts lifting off the slide, rider groups were weighed twice – once at the bottom and again at the top before riding – to make sure that their combined weight was between {{convert|400|lbs}} and {{convert|550|lbs}}, and that no single rider weighed over {{convert|300|lbs}}.<ref name="Official Site">{{cite web|title=All NEW Verruckt {{!}} Schlitterbahn Kansas City Water Park |url=http://www.schlitterbahn.com/kansas-city/rides/all-new-verruckt |website=www.schlitterbahn.com |accessdate=August 10, 2016 |archive-date=October 7, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161007105243/http://www.schlitterbahn.com/kansas-city/rides/all-new-verruckt |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Draper|first1=Bill|title=AP first-person account of riding the Verruckt, the world's tallest waterslide|url=http://cjonline.com/news/2016-08-08/ap-first-person-account-riding-verruckt-worlds-tallest-waterslide|accessdate=August 10, 2016|work=The Topeka Capital-Journal|agency=Associated Press|date=August 8, 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160812153230/http://cjonline.com/news/2016-08-08/ap-first-person-account-riding-verruckt-worlds-tallest-waterslide|archivedate=August 12, 2016}}</ref>
The starting point of the ride, at {{convert|168|feet}}, was taller than either [[Niagara Falls]] or the foot-to-torch portion of the [[Statue of Liberty]].<ref name="Guinness World Records Story" /> As it was beyond the {{convert|120|feet}} that zoning codes permitted, the design required a variance (the height was increased from its initial plan of {{convert|148|feet}}, which was also above the limit).<ref name="auto">{{cite web | url=http://www.kansascity.com/news/local/article95562432.html|title=The making of Schlitterbahn’s Verruckt water slide: Too much, too fast? | first1=Steve | last1=Vockrodt | first2=Scott | last2=Canon | first3=Katy | last3=Bergen | publisher=The Kansas City Star | deadurl=no | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170202080518/http://www.kansascity.com/news/local/article95562432.html|archivedate=February 2, 2017}}</ref> After the announcement of the ride's height and the certification of its world record on April 25, 2014, Schlitterbahn tore down most of the lower part of the ride, in order to rebuild and re-engineer it after sandbags were seen flying off the ride during testing. As a result, the second drop was changed from 45 degrees to 22 degrees, an extra {{convert|5|feet}} was added to the uphill portion of the ride to slow down rafts,<ref>{{cite news|title=Opening of world's tallest water slide delayed|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2014/06/27/tallest-water-slide/11545601/|accessdate=August 10, 2016|work=[[USA Today]]|agency=Associated Press|date=June 27, 2014|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160818120926/http://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2014/06/27/tallest-water-slide/11545601/|archivedate=August 18, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Laresse|first1=Steve|title=Verruckt: Designer of tallest slide takes the plunge|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/travel/destinations/2014/06/26/verruckt-worlds-tallest-water-slide-exclusive-ride-video/11421473/|accessdate=August 10, 2016|work=USA Today|date=July 7, 2014|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160824065525/http://www.usatoday.com/story/travel/destinations/2014/06/26/verruckt-worlds-tallest-water-slide-exclusive-ride-video/11421473/|archivedate=August 24, 2016}}</ref> and a series of metal hoops and netting supported by them were added into areas where rafts had flown off in early testing.<ref name="auto"/>
==Fatal incident== On August 7, 2016, the 10-year-old son of Kansas state representative [[Scott Schwab]] died while riding Verrückt. The death occurred when the raft he was in went airborne and impacted a metal support of the netting, decapitating the child.<ref name="time.com">{{cite news|last1=Calvo|first1=Amanda|last2=Chan|first2=Melissa|title=What We Know About the Young Boy Decapitated on the World's Tallest Water Slide|url=http://time.com/4444447/caleb-schwab-verruckt-water-slide-death/|accessdate=January 3, 2017|work=[[Time (magazine)|Time]]|date=August 9, 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170103020701/http://time.com/4444447/caleb-schwab-verruckt-water-slide-death/|archivedate=January 3, 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Raine|first1=Naja|title=Caleb Schwab, 10, Decapitated in Water Slide Accident, Police Confirm|url=http://www.people.com/article/caleb-schwab-decapitated-water-slide-accident|accessdate=August 9, 2016|publisher=People|date=August 9, 2016}}</ref> The other two passengers, both women, were injured in the incident — one suffered a broken jaw, while the other suffered a facial bone fracture and needed stitches.<ref name="PoliceDetails-Fox4" /> In the immediate aftermath, the park was closed pending an inspection.<ref name="time.com"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://abcnews.go.com/US/schlitterbahn-waterpark-kansas-reopen-wednesday-10-year-olds/story?id=41233945|title=Kansas Waterpark to Reopen Wednesday After Boy's Death|first=Emily|last=Shapiro|date=August 9, 2016|publisher=[[ABC News]]}}</ref> Although the park reopened three days later, the ride was closed forever.<ref name="PoliceDetails-Fox4">{{cite web |first1=Stephanie |last1=Graflage |first2=Mary |last2=Pulley |url=http://fox4kc.com/2016/08/08/kck-police-release-details-about-water-park-tragedy-pastor-provides-statement-on-10-year-old-boy-killed/|title=KCK police release details about water park tragedy; pastor provides statement on 10-year-old boy killed|date=August 8, 2016|publisher=WDAF|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160809162544/http://fox4kc.com/2016/08/08/kck-police-release-details-about-water-park-tragedy-pastor-provides-statement-on-10-year-old-boy-killed/|archivedate=August 9, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Campbell|first1=Matt|last2=Cronkleton|first2=Robert|last3=Adler|first3=Eric|title=Son of Kansas lawmaker dies on Verrückt slide at Schlitterbahn water park in Kansas City, Kan.|url=http://www.kansascity.com/news/local/article94254507.html|date=August 7, 2016|work=The Kansas City Star|accessdate=August 8, 2016| archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160808072815/http://www.kansascity.com/news/local/article94254507.html |archivedate=August 8, 2016|dead-url=no}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.slate.com/blogs/moneybox/2016/08/08/a_boy_died_on_a_water_slide_in_kansas_one_of_many_states_that_barely_regulates.html|title=A Boy Died on This Water Slide—in One of the Many States That Barely Ensure That Rides Are Safe|first=Helaine|last=Olen|publisher=Slate|date=August 8, 2016 | deadurl=no | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160809164128/http://www.slate.com/blogs/moneybox/2016/08/08/a_boy_died_on_a_water_slide_in_kansas_one_of_many_states_that_barely_regulates.html|archivedate=August 9, 2016}}</ref>
An investigation found that the boy, who weighed {{convert|74|lb}}, had been allowed to sit in the front of the raft, rather than between the two women accompanying him — one weighed {{convert|275|lb}}, while the other weighed {{convert|197|lb}}.<ref name="WeightDistribution-Inquisitr" /> This led to an uneven [[weight distribution]] that contributed to the raft going airborne, despite the cumulative weight of {{convert|546|lb}} being under the maximum recommended weight of {{convert|550|lb}}.<ref name="WeightDistribution-Inquisitr">{{cite news|publisher=Insquistr|first=Tara|last=West|url=http://www.inquisitr.com/3433889/verruckt-waterslide-death-result-of-poor-weight-distribution-experts-say-caleb-schwab-should-have-been-in-center-seat/|title=Verruckt Waterslide Death Result Of Poor Weight Distribution? Experts Say Caleb Schwab Should Have Been In Center Seat|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160821173440/http://www.inquisitr.com/3433889/verruckt-waterslide-death-result-of-poor-weight-distribution-experts-say-caleb-schwab-should-have-been-in-center-seat/|archivedate=August 21, 2016}}</ref> Engineers who inspected the ride also commented that the ride's netting, used in areas where riders travel up to {{convert|70|mph}}, "posed its own hazard because a rider moving at high speeds could easily lose a limb if they hit it".<ref name="auto"/> Their findings revealed that the use of the metal brace and netting system in the design,<ref name="kcstarindictment">{{cite news|last1=Vockrodt|first1=Steve|last2=Rizzo|first2=Tony|last3=Baurer|first3=Laura|last4=Rice|first4=Glenn E.|title=Schlitterbahn corporation, ex-manager indicted in Verruckt water slide death|url=http://www.kansascity.com/news/article206605804.html|work=Kansas City Star|date=March 23, 2018|access-date=March 25, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180325054321/http://www.kansascity.com/news/article206605804.html#|archive-date=March 25, 2018|dead-url=no|df=mdy-all}}</ref> along with the use of [[Hook and loop fastener|hook and loop]] straps to restrain the riders,<ref name="ASTM Restraint">{{cite web|title=State of Kansas v. Tyler Austin Miles, Schlitterbahn Waterpark of Kansas City, Kansas|pages=16-17|quote=According to ASTM, hook-and-loop material should never be used as a safety device on an amusement ride. The correct restraint system for a ride like Verrückt would be a Class 5 restraint consisting of rigid overhead shoulder bars with a locking lap restraint.|url=http://www.kansascity.com/latest-news/article206611679.ece/BINARY/Read%20the%20full%20Schlitterbahn%20corporation%20indictment|date=March 28, 2018|access-date=March 26, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180326174428/http://www.kansascity.com/latest-news/article206611679.ece/BINARY/Read%20the%20full%20Schlitterbahn%20corporation%20indictment#|archive-date=March 26, 2018|dead-url=no|df=mdy-all}}</ref> went against guidelines set by [[ASTM International|ASTM]] F-24 Committee on Amusement Ride and Devices.<ref>{{cite web|title=ASTM International|url=http://www.waterparks.org/web/Tagged_Content/Hot_Topics/ASTM.aspx|website=www.waterparks.org|access-date=March 26, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180326183149/http://www.waterparks.org/web/Tagged_Content/Hot_Topics/ASTM.aspx#|archive-date=March 26, 2018|dead-url=no|df=mdy-all}}</ref> According to the guidelines, Verrückt should have incorporated the use of a rigid over-the-shoulder restraint for riders,<ref name="ASTM Restraint" /> and an [[Underfriction|upstop]] mechanism to prevent the rafts from going airborne.<ref name="ASTM Upstop">{{cite web|title=State of Kansas v. Tyler Austin Miles, Schlitterbahn Waterpark of Kansas City, Kansas|pages=16|quote=The rafts were designed and constructed without any "upstop" mechanisms to prevent rafts from going airborne. Upstop mechanisms have been used for decades and are common safety features in the amusement ride industry.|url=http://www.kansascity.com/latest-news/article206611679.ece/BINARY/Read%20the%20full%20Schlitterbahn%20corporation%20indictment|date=March 28, 2018|access-date=March 26, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180326174428/http://www.kansascity.com/latest-news/article206611679.ece/BINARY/Read%20the%20full%20Schlitterbahn%20corporation%20indictment#|archive-date=March 26, 2018|dead-url=no|df=mdy-all}}</ref>
On March 23, 2018, a grand jury issued an indictment against Schlitterbahn and Tyler Austin Miles, former director of operations, charging them with involuntary manslaughter, aggravated battery, aggravated child endangerment, and interference with law enforcement.<ref name="kcstarindictment" /><ref name="Indictment-Miles">{{cite web|title=State of Kansas v. Tyler Austin Miles, Schlitterbahn Waterpark of Kansas City, Kansas|url=http://www.kansascity.com/latest-news/article206611679.ece/BINARY/Read%20the%20full%20Schlitterbahn%20corporation%20indictment|date=March 28, 2018|publisher=Wyandotte County, Kansas|access-date=March 26, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180326174428/http://www.kansascity.com/latest-news/article206611679.ece/BINARY/Read%20the%20full%20Schlitterbahn%20corporation%20indictment#|archive-date=March 26, 2018|dead-url=no|df=mdy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Phillips|first1=Kristine|title=A boy was decapitated on a waterslide. The park knew the ride could kill people, officials say.|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/post-nation/wp/2018/03/24/a-boy-was-decapitated-on-a-waterslide-the-park-knew-the-ride-could-kill-people-officials-say/|work=Washington Post|date=March 25, 2018|access-date=March 26, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180326142044/https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/post-nation/wp/2018/03/24/a-boy-was-decapitated-on-a-waterslide-the-park-knew-the-ride-could-kill-people-officials-say/#|archive-date=March 26, 2018|dead-url=no|df=mdy-all}}</ref> The indictment accused the park of negligence, concealing design flaws, and downplaying the severity of previous injuries reported on the ride.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://fox4kc.com/2018/03/23/court-documents-detail-allegations-of-negligence-in-design-of-schlitterbahn-water-slide-that-killed-10-year-old/|title=Court documents detail alleged negligence in design of Schlitterbahn water slide that killed 10-year-old|date=March 23, 2018|website=fox4kc.com|access-date=March 23, 2018|first=Makenzie|last=Koch|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180324101558/http://fox4kc.com/2018/03/23/court-documents-detail-allegations-of-negligence-in-design-of-schlitterbahn-water-slide-that-killed-10-year-old/#|archive-date=March 24, 2018|dead-url=no|df=mdy-all}}</ref><ref name="kcstarindictment" /> Three days later, on March 26, Jeff Henry was arrested in [[Cameron County, Texas]], in connection with the incident.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.kansascity.com/news/article206886324.html|title=Schlitterbahn co-owner Jeff Henry arrested in Texas on Verruckt-related charges|work=The Kansas City Star|access-date=March 27, 2018|language=en|date=March 26, 2018|last1=Vockrodt|first1=Steve|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180327004757/http://www.kansascity.com/news/article206886324.html#|archive-date=March 27, 2018|dead-url=no|df=mdy-all}}</ref> A day later, on March 27, the [[Kansas Attorney General|Kansas Attorney General's]] office released a new indictment against Henry, co-designer John Schooley, and Henry & Sons Construction Company — privately-owned by Schlitterbahn — charging them with second-degree murder in addition to 17 other felonies.<ref name="Indictment-Henry/Schooley">{{cite web|title=State of Kansas v. Jeffrey Wayne Henry, John Timothy Schooley, Henry & Sons Construction Company|url=https://www.wycocourtks.org/uploads/4/4/1/2/4412070/indictment.pdf|publisher=Wyandotte County, Kansas|accessdate=March 28, 2018|date=March 21, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180328021007/https://www.wycocourtks.org/uploads/4/4/1/2/4412070/indictment.pdf#|archive-date=March 28, 2018|dead-url=no|df=mdy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Vockrodt|first1=Steve|last2=Rizzo|first2=Tony|title=Schlitterbahn executives charged with second-degree murder in Verruckt case|url=http://www.kansascity.com/news/local/crime/article207001119.html|work=The Kansas City Star|date=March 27, 2018|language=en|access-date=March 28, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180328102619/http://www.kansascity.com/news/local/crime/article207001119.html#|archive-date=March 28, 2018|dead-url=no|df=mdy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Hanna|first1=John|title=Park owner, slide designer charged with murder in boy's waterpark death|url=http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/nationworld/ct-kansas-water-park-death-charges-20180326-story.html|work=Chicago Tribune|date=March 27, 2018|agency=Associated Press|access-date=March 28, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180328044835/http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/nationworld/ct-kansas-water-park-death-charges-20180326-story.html#|archive-date=March 28, 2018|dead-url=no|df=mdy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Brocchetto|first1=Marilia|last2=Gray|first2=Melissa|title=Kansas water park executives charged with murder in boy's death|url=https://www.cnn.com/2018/03/27/us/schlitterbahn-waterpark-death-arrests/index.html|work=CNN|date=March 27, 2018|access-date=March 28, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180328043625/https://www.cnn.com/2018/03/27/us/schlitterbahn-waterpark-death-arrests/index.html#|archive-date=March 28, 2018|dead-url=no|df=mdy-all}}</ref> Schooley was arrested at [[Dallas/Fort Worth International Airport]] after returning from a trip to [[China]] on April 2, 2018.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Cronkleton|first1=Robert A.|last2=Vockrodt|first2=Steve|title=Schlitterbahn's Verruckt designer John Schooley arrested in Dallas|url=http://www.kansascity.com/article207778379.html|accessdate=April 3, 2018|work=The Kansas City Star|date=April 6, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180403170308/http://www.kansascity.com/article207778379.html#|archive-date=April 3, 2018|dead-url=no|df=mdy-all}}</ref>
The 2018 indictment against Schlitterbahn wrote that Henry and Schooley "lacked technical expertise to design a properly functioning water slide" and did not perform standard engineering procedures or calculations on how the slide would operate.<ref name="kcstarindictment" /> Instead they used "crude trial-and-error methods" to test its performance, out of haste to launch the ride.<ref name="kcstarindictment" /> According to court documents, Schooley conceded that “If we actually knew how to do this, and it could be done that easily, it wouldn’t be that spectacular.”<ref name="Independent">{{cite news|last1=Barnes|first1=Tom|title=Designers of water slide that decapitated boy 'had no technical qualifications'|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/water-slide-boy-verr-ckt-child-death-decapitation-designers-no-qualifications-schlitterbahn-a8272036.html|accessdate=March 25, 2018|newspaper=[[The Independent]]|quote=A total of 11 people suffered injuries, including slipped spinal disks, whiplash, broken toes and lacerations on the ride in the period between when it became operational in July 2014 and the day of the fatal crash.|date=March 24, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180325001432/https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/water-slide-boy-verr-ckt-child-death-decapitation-designers-no-qualifications-schlitterbahn-a8272036.html#|archive-date=March 25, 2018|dead-url=no|df=mdy-all}}</ref>
==Closure== On November 22, 2016, Schlitterbahn announced that Verrückt would be demolished following the closure of a criminal investigation.<ref name="Closed-KSHB">{{cite news|url=http://www.kshb.com/news/local-news/schlitterbahn-kansas-city-announces-verruckt-water-slide-to-be-removed-after-child-death-in-august|title=Schlitterbahn Kansas City announces Verruckt water slide to be removed after child death in August|first=Ariel|last=Rothfield|publisher=41 Action News Staff|date=November 23, 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161123141011/http://www.kshb.com/news/local-news/schlitterbahn-kansas-city-announces-verruckt-water-slide-to-be-removed-after-child-death-in-august|archivedate=November 23, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Porter|first1=Toriano|last2=Bauer|first2=Laura|title=Schlitterbahn will close Verrückt water slide where 10-year-old boy was killed|url=http://www.kansascity.com/news/local/article116542643.html|accessdate=November 23, 2016|work=The Kansas City Star|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161123063330/http://www.kansascity.com/news/local/article116542643.html|archivedate=November 23, 2016}}</ref> In July 2018, a judge approved a plan by the park to disassemble the ride beginning the following September.<ref name="Disassembly-KCS">{{cite news|title=Schlitterbahn to tear down Verruckt water slide in KCK where young boy died in 2016|url=https://www.kansascity.com/news/local/article214766785.html|accessdate=July 13, 2018|work=Kansas City Star|date=July 12, 2018|first1=Steve|last1=Vockrodt|first2=Lauren|last2=Fox|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180712224231/https://www.kansascity.com/news/local/article214766785.html#|archive-date=July 12, 2018|dead-url=no|df=mdy-all}}</ref><ref name="Disassembly-NPR">{{cite news|last1=Romo|first1=Vanessa|title=Court Grants Permission To Destroy World's Tallest Waterslide|url=https://www.npr.org/2018/07/12/628587296/court-grants-permission-to-destroy-worlds-tallest-waterslide|accessdate=July 18, 2018|work=National Public Radio|date=July 12, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180718002400/https://www.npr.org/2018/07/12/628587296/court-grants-permission-to-destroy-worlds-tallest-waterslide#|archive-date=July 18, 2018|dead-url=no|df=mdy-all}}</ref> The ride's teardown was placed on hold indefinitely in August 2018, resulting from ongoing discussions in multiple court cases that were filed after the incident.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kwch.com/content/news/Plans-to-tear-down-water-slide-where-boy-died-on-hold-491682851.html|title=Plans to tear down water slide where boy died on hold|first=|last=KWCH|publisher=|access-date=August 26, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180826214731/http://www.kwch.com/content/news/Plans-to-tear-down-water-slide-where-boy-died-on-hold-491682851.html#|archive-date=August 26, 2018|dead-url=no|df=mdy-all}}</ref>
The first criminal trial began on October 5, 2018.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.wibw.com/content/news/First-trial-begins-in-Schlitterbahn-tragedy-497643981.html |title=First trial begins in Schlitterbahn tragedy |publisher=[[WIBW-TV|WIBW]] |date=October 15, 2018 |accessdate=October 31, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181016110627/https://www.wibw.com/content/news/First-trial-begins-in-Schlitterbahn-tragedy-497643981.html# |archive-date=October 16, 2018 |dead-url=no |df=mdy-all }}</ref> {{citation needed span|date=December 2018|text=As of November 2018, the ride is being dismantled.}}
